title: Elden Ring Strategy Guides Finally Restocked At Amazon - Get All Three While You Can
description: Elden Ring: Books of Knowledge Vol. 1 - The Lands Between $45 (was $50) See at Amazon Elden Ring: Books of Knowledge Vol. 2 - Shards of the Shattering $50 See at Amazon Elden Ring: Books of Knowledge Vol. 3 - Shadow of the Erdtree $40.49 (was $45) See at Amazon Elden Ring fans can finally get all three official strategy guides for retail price or less. Amazon has a fresh restock of the popular Books of Knowledge series from Future Press. Volume 1 is available for $45 (was $50), Volume 2 is $50, and the recently released third volume covering Shadow of the Erdtree is $40.49. If you're interested in these Elden Ring guides, especially the first two, we'd recommend ordering them as soon as possible. Once they sell out, you might be stuck waiting for months, perhaps many of them, for a new printing.Volume 3 wasn't hard to find before today, but Volumes 1 and 2 had been sold out for most of 2024. Volume 2, in particular, was often listed on eBay for well over $100; there are still copies of it on eBay for north of $200. Thankfully, Elden Ring fans no longer need to entertain the idea of paying double or triple the MSRP for any of these books.Elden Ring Books of Knowledge Strategy GuidesAll three books will arrive before Christmas, so you can give the Elden Ring fan in your life the gift of knowledge this holiday.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metaphor: ReFantazio's Massive Official Strategy Guide Up For Preorder At Amazon
description: Metaphor: ReFantazio Official Strategy Guide (Hardcover) $55 | Releases February 28, 2025 Preorder at Amazon Metaphor: ReFantazio $50 (was $70) for PS5 and Xbox Series X See at Amazon Metaphor: ReFantazio is getting an official strategy guide on February 28, 2025, and you can preorder it now at Amazon for $55. Published by Future Press, the Metaphor: ReFantazio Strategy Guide is a 592-page hardcover book featuring mountains of information and full-color images "that recaptures Atlus's wonderfully unique style on the printed page," according to the Amazon listing.Official strategy guides are uncommon these days, and this is the first one for an Atlus game in quite some time. Considering the popularity of Metaphor and Atlus role-playing games in general, we imagine this could sell out, so you may want to secure your preorder soon. Future Press has a great track record for making beautiful strategy guides, including a trio of Elden Ring strategy guides that are finally back in stock at Amazon. You can check out a list of notable Future Press guidebooks at the bottom of this story. Metaphor: ReFantazio Official Strategy Guide (Hardcover) $55 | Releases February 28, 2025 Metaphor: ReFantazio's massive official strategy guide sounds like both an awesome collectible for Atlus fans and a comprehensive compendium of everything you could possibly want to know about the game.Along with a complete walkthrough designed so that you see and do everything, the guidebook has multiple catalogs of useful information to pore over:Archetype Encyclopedia: An exhaustive section covering all skills, Synthesis attacks, and inheritance options.Equipment catalog: All items and equipment are included in a section designed to be used as a quick reference sheet.Bestiary: Every enemy in the game is chronicled with in-depth stats, including strengths and weaknesses, item drop rates, and other pertinent details.Dialogue trees: All of the choice-based dialogue and actions made in the game are outlined to help you form bonds with characters based on your personal preferences.Appendices: For those who want true 100% completion, this section contains the full Memorandum, has New Game+ details, an achievements and trophies guide, and a build guide to help you be as prepared as possible for Metaphor's toughest challenges.It also comes with a poster-sized map of Euchronia that's an exact replica of the in-game map. Preorder at Amazon Metaphor: ReFantazio $50 (was $70) for PS5 and Xbox Series X If you don't own Metaphor: ReFantazio or want to buy a copy as a gift for a friend this holiday, Amazon still has the physical edition for PS5 and Xbox Series X on sale for its Black Friday price of $50. See at Amazon From Software Strategy GuidesFuture's Books of Knowledge series has proven to be incredibly popular. The first two volumes have been sold out for many months, but Amazon finally received more copies from a fresh print run. Volume 3, which released in October, covers the huge Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Beneath A Steel Sky at 30: how Terry Gilliam's Brazil and a week in Wales sowed the seeds of this classic adventure game
description: Founded in 1989, Yorkshire-based Revolution Software hit the ground running with Lure of the Temptress, an advanced 3D point-and-click adventure that utilised Revolution's own Virtual Theatre engine. "We were reaching the end [on Lure of the Temptress], and it was the most intense time, testing and checking it," remembers Charles Cecil, co-founder of Revolution alongside Tony Warriner, Noirin Carmody and David Sykes. "And the problem was, as a one-team, one-project company, we were having to start the next one at the same time." Hence the development detox for Warriner and Cummins, despatched to a remote Cecil family cottage in North Wales. When the pair returned, they had a 12-page design for Revolution's next game. Read more
author: Graeme Mason

title: Boomer shooter dev discovers his dogs have been barking on an "unbearable" loop for years
description: Sometimes dogs are hard to shut up. Over a year and half after releasing Hrot from early access, the developer of the Quake-inspired shooter has fixed the dogs after discovering that a few of the canines have been, for some players, barking in a hideous and endless loop. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell

title: Playing Wreckfest while learning to drive was surprisingly helpful
description: At 9 years old, in the plastic seats of a Sega Rally arcade machine, I quickly learned that "automatic" is better than "manual" without understanding why. And now I know: changing gears is a fucking chore. This year, in my mid-thirties, I finally learned to drive. And weirdly, a racing game about destroying clapped-out old bangers helped me along. Thank you Wreckfest, for all the bottled road rage you allowed me to unleash. Read more

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 861
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Who would you rather go dancing with: your significant other, your best friend or your kid (if you have one)? Honestly, I’d love to go with Connor, LOL! 2. Spa weekend or a music festival weekend? Spa weekend, 100%. 3. Have you had any eggnog this holiday season? Nope, none! I don’t really crave it, but if it’s there, I’ll have a small cup. 4. Who would you rather have lunch with: your favorite musician, your favorite actor, your favorite author or your favorite teacher? Honestly, if she was still alive, lunch with my favorite teacher from elementary would be lovely. The last time I saw her, I was 18. 5. Do you pop the zit or leave it alone? I dunno, how ripe is it? If[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 861 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 842
description: This was an exciting time of year for Tabs. Company coming over, trees INSIDE the house, blinking lights, the biggest turkeys of the year — for a cat like Tabs, the holidays were a cat cornucopia of comfy couches, fragrant foliage, tinsel, tasty treats and plump plumage. As the head of the decorating committee for Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC, Tabs was responsible for the Christmas tree decorations, and I just sort of did what he said. Normally, it would go down something like this: first week of December, and he hadn’t decided on the overall theme yet, but he’d have it narrowed down to something like baked red, green and silver catnip crispy ornament treats or strings of classic white lights and red Christmas balls. Probably. But he wouldn’t be sure yet. Whichever way it went, he always got a lot of help. The decorating committee was always on standby and awaiting orders. And Tabs? Well, he was always late because of this or that. A lot of the time it was just because[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 842 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
